bibl.title: Letter from Willard L. Beaulac to Philip Showalter Hench, January 23, 1953

div1.p: Beaulac is sending Hench the seating plan of the dinner, which followed the Camp Lazear dedication, along with an extra set of photographs of the Camp Lazear ceremony.

div1.head: Letter from Willard L. Beaulac to Philip Showalter Hench, January 23, 1953
div1.opener:
THE FOREIGN SERVICE
OF THE
UNITED STATES OF AMERICA
Habana, January 23, 1953
ADDRESS OFFICIAL COMMUNICATIONS TO
Dear Dr. Hench:
div1.p:
I did not forget your request for a seating
plan of the dinner - although, I must say, I have
broken no records in getting it to you.

Here it is, with an extra set of pictures of
the ceremony. They are very interesting, in more
ways than one!

It was fine to see you down here, and I hope
you can make it again sometime soon.

Mrs. Beaulac joins me in kindest personal
regards.
div1.closer:
Sincerely yours, Willard L. Beaulac Enclosures
Dr. Philip S. Hench
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minnesota
